thread.title: Egypt: More Indian Investments to Come to Egyptian Market - - Diplomat
thread.title_full: Egypt: More Indian Investments to Come to Egyptian Market - - Diplomat

title: Egypt: More Indian Investments to Come to Egyptian Market - - Diplomat
text:
Egypt: U.S. State Department - Egypt Able to Defeat Terrorism 
Indian Ambassador in Cairo Sanjay Bhattacharyya said on Thursday 01/10/2015 that New Delhi has plans to increase its investments in Egypt through new projects in the Suez Canal development axis. 
The diplomat made the remarks during a conference held at Cairo International Convention Center on the occasion of the participation of 33 Indian companies at a textiles fair, which runs for four days. 
The fair is organized by the Project Exports Promotion Council of India (PEPC) in cooperation with the Indian Embassy in Cairo and the Egyptian Chamber of Commerce. 
Indian investors are waiting for more details on the mega development axis, Bhattacharyya told the conference. 
The diplomat highlighted developing relations linking the two sides, saying that Egypt's President Abdel Fattah El Sisi and the Indian prime minister held their first of kind meeting on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly meetings in New York. 
They discussed economic cooperation and issues of common interest, he said. 
MENA
